subject: College Athletics
Golf
lead_paragraph: North Carolina State’s Matt Hill made three birdies on the back nine and held off his closest pursuers to win the individual title in the N.C.A.A. Division I championship at Inverness Club in Toledo, Ohio. Hill, a sophomore from Bright’s Grove, Ontario, shot his third consecutive two-under 69 to finish at six-under 207. The Clemson junior Kyle Stanley matched the day’s low round with a 66 to finish second, two strokes back. Oklahoma State led the eight teams qualifying for the new match-play format, which begins with the quarterfinals Friday morning. The team championship match is set for Saturday morning.
